ground_truth: She stubs out the cigarette and takes down the guilt frame photo. Setting her chin defiantly, she shuts the black and white photo away in the drawer. In the morning, she's lying asleep on her bed fully clothed as Charlotte in a skull cap and dressing gown bursts into her room and starts pulling clothes from the wardrobe. Later, elegantly dressed on the porch, Charlotte tries to eavesdrop on Stuart and Skeeter as she waters her plants. He starts walking away. Skeeter, glancing back towards the house, frowns speculatively. She strides past her smiling date. In a diner, shirt sleeves rolled up, he's ordered oysters. They clink oyster and cracker. He reaches across and takes her hand. She responds with a smile. Outside the diner, Stuart grabs her hand. He steps towards her and kisses her on the lips. Mae Mobley is sitting on Aibileen's knee with a picture book. Hilly comes out of her house grimacing. She pushes aside a press photographer. Toilets are scattered on the yard. She cradles her Yard of the Month sign and carries it inside to the amusement of the onlookers. Mae Mobley, with her knickers down, proudly sits on one of the many toilets scattered across the lawn. Elizabeth drags her off. Tenderly carrying Mae Mobley in her arms, Aibileen sets her down on the lawn surrounded by a dozen toilets. She kneels in front of her. Taking hold of her hands, she looks deeply into the child's moon face. They hug each other. Elizabeth, watching coldly from the front door, goes inside. At the Phelan's, Skeeter, Josefo, and Pascagoula are watching civil rights activist Medgar Evers on TV. Charlotte turns off the TV. The servants scoot away. Charlotte grabs Skeeter by the hand. Skeeter pulls away and goes. On a bus on her way home, Aibileen is napping. Henry, sitting nearby, looks up from his book. The bus stops. The driver switches on the inside lights and faces the passengers. Aibileen and Henry, who have been sitting at the back of the bus, hurriedly get out and walk off down the dark street. He goes. Seeing Henry disappear around the corner, Aibileen starts to run. Civil rights activist Roy Wilkins comments. Aibileen trips and falls. Minnie's children leave the kitchen. The three younger ones pile into one bed. The two friends put their arms around each other. With a somber expression, Skeeter flips back to the front cover of the LIFE magazine, which shows the distraught widow comforting her young son. At the foot mansion, Minnie is hoovering down a stuffed standing grizzly bear on a corner dice. She looks towards the fad and steps down from the platform. She strolls through the spacious rooms and comes into the bedroom, making a beeline for the bathroom door.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description: She extinguishes the cigarette with a decisive motion and carefully takes down the framed photograph that has been hanging on the wall, a symbol of her guilt. With a determined set to her chin, she places the black and white photo into the drawer, shutting it away from view. The next morning, she is found lying asleep on her bed, still fully clothed from the night before. Suddenly, Charlotte, wearing a skull cap and a dressing gown, bursts energetically into the room and begins pulling clothes from the wardrobe with urgency. Later on, Charlotte, now elegantly dressed, stands on the porch, attempting to discreetly eavesdrop on Stuart and Skeeter as she tends to her plants by watering them. Stuart begins to walk away, and Skeeter, casting a glance back towards the house, frowns with a speculative expression. She strides confidently past her smiling date. In a bustling diner, with his shirt sleeves rolled up, he has ordered a plate of oysters. They clink together an oyster and a cracker in a small celebratory gesture. He reaches across the table and gently takes her hand, to which she responds with a warm smile. Outside the diner, Stuart firmly grabs her hand, steps closer, and kisses her tenderly on the lips. Meanwhile, Mae Mobley is comfortably seated on Aibileen's knee, engrossed in a picture book. Hilly emerges from her house with a grimace on her face, pushing aside a press photographer who is in her way. The yard is scattered with toilets, a sight that draws attention. She cradles her Yard of the Month sign protectively and carries it inside, much to the amusement of the onlookers. Mae Mobley, with her knickers down, proudly sits on one of the many toilets scattered across the lawn, but Elizabeth quickly drags her off. Tenderly, Aibileen carries Mae Mobley in her arms and sets her down gently on the lawn, surrounded by a dozen toilets. She kneels in front of the child, taking hold of her small hands, and looks deeply into her moon-shaped face. They embrace each other warmly. Elizabeth, watching with a cold demeanor from the front door, turns and goes inside. At the Phelan's residence, Skeeter, Josefo, and Pascagoula are intently watching civil rights activist Medgar Evers on the television. Charlotte abruptly turns off the TV, causing the servants to quickly disperse. Charlotte grabs Skeeter by the hand, but Skeeter pulls away and leaves. On a bus heading home, Aibileen is napping peacefully. Nearby, Henry looks up from his book. The bus comes to a stop, and the driver switches on the inside lights, facing the passengers. Aibileen and Henry, who have been sitting at the back of the bus, hurriedly get out and walk off down the dark street. Henry goes his separate way. Seeing Henry disappear around the corner, Aibileen starts to run. Civil rights activist Roy Wilkins is heard commenting. Aibileen trips and falls. Minnie's children leave the kitchen, and the three younger ones pile into one bed. The two friends put their arms around each other in a comforting embrace. With a somber expression, Skeeter flips back to the front cover of the LIFE magazine, which features the distraught widow comforting her young son. At the foot mansion, Minnie is diligently hoovering down a stuffed standing grizzly bear positioned on a corner dice. She looks towards the fad and steps down from the platform. She strolls through the spacious rooms and makes her way into the bedroom, heading directly for the bathroom door.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description: With a decisive and deliberate motion, she extinguishes the cigarette and then carefully takes down the framed photograph that has long been hanging on the wall, a lingering symbol of her deep-seated guilt. With a determined expression set firmly on her face, she places the somber black-and-white photo into the drawer, shutting it away from view and mind. When the next morning arrives, she is discovered lying asleep on her bed, still fully dressed in the clothes she wore from the night before. Suddenly, Charlotte, wearing a snug skull cap and a cozy dressing gown, bursts energetically into the room, immediately beginning to pull clothes from the wardrobe with a sense of urgency. Later on, Charlotte, now elegantly dressed to perfection, stands on the porch, attempting to discreetly eavesdrop on the conversation between Stuart and Skeeter as she tends to her plants, watering them with care. As Stuart begins to walk away, Skeeter, casting a glance back towards the house, frowns with a thoughtful, speculative expression on her face. She strides confidently past her date, who is smiling warmly at her. In a bustling, lively diner, with his shirt sleeves rolled up casually, he has ordered a plate of fresh oysters. They celebrate with a small, unique gesture by clinking together an oyster and a cracker. He reaches across the table with a gentle touch and takes her hand, to which she responds by giving him a warm, affectionate smile. Outside the diner, Stuart firmly holds her hand, steps closer with determination, and kisses her tenderly on the lips. Meanwhile, Mae Mobley sits comfortably on Aibileen's knee, thoroughly engrossed in a colorful picture book. Hilly emerges from her house with a distinct grimace on her face, pushing aside a press photographer obstructively standing in her way. The yard outside is scattered with toilets, an unusual sight that draws significant attention. Hilly cradles her Yard of the Month sign protectively and carries it inside the house, much to the amusement of the onlookers. Mae Mobley, with her knickers down, proudly sits on one of the several toilets scattered across the lawn, but Elizabeth promptly drags her off. With a tender touch, Aibileen carries Mae Mobley in her arms and gently sets her down on the lawn, surrounded by a dozen toilets. She kneels in front of the child, takes hold of her small, soft hands, and looks deeply into her innocent, moon-shaped face. They embrace each other warmly and affectionately. Elizabeth, watching with a cold, distant demeanor from the front door, turns and retreats inside. At the Phelan's residence, Skeeter, Josefo, and Pascagoula are intently focused on watching civil rights activist Medgar Evers on the television. Charlotte abruptly turns off the TV, causing the servants to scatter and disperse quickly. Grabbing Skeeter by the hand, Charlotte tries to hold her, but Skeeter pulls away and leaves. On a bus heading home, Aibileen is peacefully napping. Nearby, Henry looks up momentarily from his book. The bus comes to a stop, and the driver switches on the inside lights, facing the passengers directly. Aibileen and Henry, who have been quietly sitting at the back of the bus, hurriedly get out and walk off, down the dark street. Henry goes his separate way, disappearing into the night. Seeing Henry disappear around the corner, Aibileen starts to run with urgency. The words of civil rights activist Roy Wilkins are heard in the background, commenting. Aibileen trips and stumbles, falling down. Minnie's children leave the kitchen, and the three younger ones pile into one bed together. The two friends put their arms around each other in a comforting, supportive embrace. With a somber expression on her face, Skeeter flips back to the front cover of the LIFE magazine, which features the distraught widow comforting her young son in a poignant image. At the foot mansion, Minnie is diligently hoovering down a stuffed standing grizzly bear positioned on a corner dice. She looks towards the distance with contemplation and steps down from the platform. She strolls through the spacious, elegant rooms and makes her way deliberately into the bedroom, heading directly for the bathroom door.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: She extinguishes the cigarette with a firm press, ensuring the ember is completely out, and then reaches up to carefully take down the guilt-framed photo from its place. With a determined set to her chin, she decisively places the black and white photo into the drawer, closing it with a sense of finality. The next morning, she is sprawled on her bed, still in her clothes from the previous day, when Charlotte, wearing a skull cap and dressing gown, energetically bursts into the room. Without hesitation, Charlotte begins to pull clothes from the wardrobe, creating a flurry of fabric. Later, Charlotte, now elegantly dressed, stands on the porch, subtly trying to catch snippets of conversation between Stuart and Skeeter as she tends to her plants, watering them with deliberate care. As Stuart begins to walk away, Skeeter casts a backward glance towards the house, his expression thoughtful and speculative. She confidently strides past her date, who is smiling at her. In a diner, with his shirt sleeves rolled up, he has ordered oysters, and they share a moment of camaraderie as they clink an oyster and a cracker together. He reaches across the table to take her hand, and she responds with a warm smile. Outside the diner, Stuart seizes her hand, steps closer, and kisses her gently on the lips. Meanwhile, Mae Mobley is comfortably seated on Aibileen's knee, engrossed in a picture book. Hilly emerges from her house with a grimace, pushing past a press photographer with irritation. Scattered across the yard are numerous toilets, and she cradles her Yard of the Month sign, carrying it inside while onlookers find amusement in the scene. Mae Mobley, with her knickers down, proudly perches on one of the many toilets scattered across the lawn, only to be quickly pulled off by Elizabeth. Aibileen, with tenderness, carries Mae Mobley in her arms and sets her down gently on the lawn, surrounded by the dozen toilets. Kneeling in front of her, Aibileen takes the child's hands, looking deeply into her moon-like face, and they share a heartfelt hug. Elizabeth, observing coldly from the front door, turns and goes inside. At the Phelan's, Skeeter, Josefo, and Pascagoula are intently watching civil rights activist Medgar Evers on TV until Charlotte abruptly turns off the television, prompting the servants to quickly disperse. Charlotte then grabs Skeeter by the hand, but Skeeter pulls away and leaves. On a bus heading home, Aibileen is napping, while Henry, sitting nearby, glances up from his book. As the bus comes to a halt, the driver switches on the interior lights and addresses the passengers. Aibileen and Henry, seated at the back, hurriedly disembark and walk briskly down the dark street. As Henry disappears around a corner, Aibileen begins to run, spurred by the urgency of the moment. Civil rights activist Roy Wilkins' voice comments in the background as Aibileen trips and falls. In another scene, Minnie's children leave the kitchen, with the three younger ones piling into one bed, while the two friends embrace each other with their arms around one another. With a somber expression, Skeeter flips back to the front cover of the LIFE magazine, which features the image of a distraught widow comforting her young son. At the foot mansion, Minnie is diligently hoovering a stuffed standing grizzly bear positioned on a corner dice. She pauses to glance towards the fad, then steps down from the platform and strolls through the spacious rooms, making her way directly to the bathroom door.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description: She extinguishes the cigarette and defiantly stores the framed photo in a drawer. The next morning, she is asleep fully clothed when Charlotte, in a skull cap and dressing gown, bursts in and starts selecting clothes from the wardrobe. Later, Charlotte, elegantly dressed, attempts to eavesdrop on Stuart and Skeeter from the porch while tending to her plants. As Stuart walks away, Skeeter glances back at the house with a speculative frown and strides past her smiling date. In a diner, they share oysters and a smile, and he reaches for her hand. Outside, Stuart takes her hand and kisses her. Meanwhile, Mae Mobley sits on Aibileen's knee with a picture book. Hilly exits her house, grimacing as she pushes past a press photographer, cradling her Yard of the Month sign amidst scattered toilets, amusing onlookers. Mae Mobley, with her knickers down, proudly sits on one of the toilets before Elizabeth drags her off. Aibileen tenderly carries Mae Mobley to the lawn surrounded by toilets, kneels, and they share a heartfelt hug. Elizabeth watches coldly from the door before going inside. At the Phelan's, Skeeter, Josefo, and Pascagoula watch Medgar Evers on TV until Charlotte turns it off, prompting the servants to leave. Charlotte grabs Skeeter's hand, but Skeeter pulls away and leaves. On a bus ride home, Aibileen naps while Henry reads nearby. When the bus stops, they hurriedly disembark and walk down the dark street. Aibileen starts to run after seeing Henry disappear around a corner, but she trips and falls as Roy Wilkins comments on civil rights. Minnie's children leave the kitchen, pile into bed, and she and a friend embrace. With a somber expression, Skeeter reflects on a LIFE magazine cover showing a distraught widow comforting her son. At the mansion, Minnie vacuums a stuffed grizzly bear, then strolls through the spacious rooms to the bathroom door.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: She stubs out the cigarette, a habit she picked up during late nights of writing, and takes down the guilt frame photo, a cherished memento from her grandmother. Setting her chin defiantly, she shuts the black and white photo away in the drawer, an heirloom capturing a family reunion from the 1950s. In the morning, she's lying asleep on her bed fully clothed as Charlotte, her vivacious younger cousin known for her eccentric fashion sense, in a skull cap and dressing gown bursts into her room and starts pulling clothes from the wardrobe, preparing for a lively day. Later, elegantly dressed on the porch, which is lined with vibrant bougainvillaea, Charlotte tries to eavesdrop on Stuart and Skeeter as she waters her plants. Stuart, a friend from college known for his charming yet mysterious demeanor, starts walking away. Skeeter, glancing back towards the house, frowns speculatively as she catches a glimpse of an old family portrait. She strides past her smiling date. In a diner, a local favorite known for its clam chowder, shirt sleeves rolled up, he's ordered oysters, a delicacy noted for its romantic associations. They clink oyster and cracker. He reaches across and takes her hand. She responds with a smile. Outside the diner, Stuart grabs her hand. He steps towards her and kisses her on the lips, a gesture signaling the deepening of their relationship. Mae Mobley is sitting on Aibileen's knee with a picture book, one of a series that Aibileen often reads to her, fostering her love for stories. Hilly comes out of her house grimacing, a reaction familiar to those aware of her disdain for disorder. She pushes aside a press photographer, eager to avoid public scrutiny. Toilets are scattered on the yard, a comedic statement against her by neighborhood pranksters. She cradles her Yard of the Month sign, evidence of her prized gardening skills, and carries it inside to the amusement of the onlookers. Mae Mobley, with her knickers down, proudly sits on one of the many toilets scattered across the lawn, a naive participant in the spectacle. Elizabeth drags her off, embarrassed by the scene. Tenderly carrying Mae Mobley in her arms, Aibileen sets her down on the lawn surrounded by a dozen toilets, creating an odd juxtaposition against the manicured landscape. She kneels in front of her. Taking hold of her hands, she looks deeply into the child's moon face, seeking to impart wisdom and love. They hug each other. Elizabeth, watching coldly from the front door, goes inside, upset about the tarnished social image. At the Phelan's, Skeeter, Josefo, and Pascagoula are watching civil rights activist Medgar Evers, whose recent assassination has sent shockwaves through the nation, on TV. Charlotte turns off the TV, concerned about the rising tension. The servants scoot away. Charlotte grabs Skeeter by the hand. Skeeter pulls away and goes, determined to make a stand. On a bus on her way home, Aibileen is napping, exhausted from the day's events. Henry, sitting nearby, looks up from his book about civil rights history. The bus stops. The driver switches on the inside lights and faces the passengers. Aibileen and Henry, who have been sitting at the back of the bus, hurriedly get out and walk off down the dark street, a path made familiar by their daily routine. He goes. Seeing Henry disappear around the corner, Aibileen starts to run, spurred by a sudden realization. Civil rights activist Roy Wilkins comments, his voice echoing in her mind as a source of inspiration. Aibileen trips and falls. Minnie's children leave the kitchen, having just finished their dinner. The three younger ones pile into one bed, a nightly ritual that brings them comfort. The two friends put their arms around each other, seeking solace in their shared experiences. With a somber expression, Skeeter flips back to the front cover of the LIFE magazine, which shows the distraught widow Coretta Scott King comforting her young son, a poignant image of loss and resilience. At the foot mansion, Minnie is hoovering down a stuffed standing grizzly bear on a corner dice, a peculiar decoration chosen by the eccentric homeowner. She looks towards the fad and steps down from the platform, feeling a sense of foreboding. She strolls through the spacious rooms, with their opulent decor, and comes into the bedroom, making a beeline for the bathroom door, where secrets often lie hidden.

test_cases.name: Addition (~50%)
test_cases.description: She stubs out the cigarette and takes down the guilt frame photo. Setting her chin defiantly she shuts the black and white photo away in the drawer. In the morning she is lying asleep on her bed fully clothed as Charlotte in a skull cap and dressing gown bursts into her room and starts pulling clothes from the wardrobe. Later elegantly dressed on the porch Charlotte tries to eavesdrop on Stuart and Skeeter as she waters her plants. He starts walking away. Skeeter glancing back towards the house frowns speculatively. She strides past her smiling date. In a diner shirt sleeves rolled up he is ordered oysters. They clink oyster and cracker. He reaches across and takes her hand. She responds with a smile. Outside the diner Stuart grabs her hand. He steps towards her and kisses her on the lips. Mae Mobley is sitting on Aibileen's knee with a picture book. Hilly comes out of her house grimacing. She pushes aside a press photographer. Toilets are scattered on the yard. She cradles her Yard of the Month sign and carries it inside to the amusement of the onlookers. Mae Mobley with her knickers down proudly sits on one of the many toilets scattered across the lawn. Elizabeth drags her off. Tenderly carrying Mae Mobley in her arms. Aibileen sets her down on the lawn surrounded by a dozen toilets. She kneels in front of her. Taking hold of her hands she looks deeply into the child's moon face. They hug each other. Elizabeth watching coldly from the front door goes inside. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. During a clandestine meeting in a snowcovered mountain lodge two rival spies exchange cryptic messages hinting at an imminent global conspiracy. their whispered words carried off by the howling wind. Inside a lavish 1920s speakeasy a troubled jazz musician pours his soul into a melancholic melody every note echoing the bittersweet memories of lost love and shattered dreams. In a futuristic space station orbiting a distant planet an intrepid crew confronts bizarre alien phenomena and an enigmatic interstellar threat pushing the limits of human endurance. Amidst the chaos of a raging civil war a compassionate medic races through bombedout streets. his every desperate step a race against time to save lives in the midst of utter devastation. On a sundappled afternoon in a quaint European village an eccentric inventor unveils a groundbreaking contraption that defies conventional physics igniting wonder and skepticism in equal measure. In a bustling marketplace in ancient Persia a cunning street thief navigates labyrinthine alleyways and vibrant bazaars. his calculated every move a daring escape from the everwatchful royal guards. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. At the Phelan's Skeeter. Josefo and Pascagoula are watching. civil rights activist Medgar Evers on TV. Charlotte turns off the TV. The servants scoot away. Charlotte grabs Skeeter by the hand. Skeeter pulls away and goes. On a bus on her way home. Aibileen is napping. Henry sitting nearby looks up from his book. The bus stops. The driver switches on the inside lights and faces the passengers. Aibileen and Henry who have been sitting at the back of the bus hurriedly get out and walk off down the dark street. He goes. Seeing Henry disappear around the corner. Aibileen starts to run. Civil rights activist Roy Wilkins comments. Aibileen trips and falls. Minnie's children leave the kitchen. The three younger ones pile into one bed. The two friends put their arms around each other. With a somber expression. Skeeter flips back to the front cover of the LIFE magazine which shows the distraught widow comforting her young son. At the foot mansion Minnie is hoovering down a stuffed standing grizzly bear on a corner dice. She looks towards the fad and steps down from the platform. She strolls through the spacious rooms and comes into the bedroom making a beeline for the bathroom door.

test_cases.name: Addition (~80%)
test_cases.description: She stubs out the cigarette and takes down the guilt frame photo. Setting her chin defiantly she shuts the black and white photo away in the drawer. In the morning she is lying asleep on her bed fully clothed as Charlotte in a skull cap and dressing gown bursts into her room and starts pulling clothes from the wardrobe. Later elegantly dressed on the porch Charlotte tries to eavesdrop on Stuart and Skeeter as she waters her plants. He starts walking away. Skeeter glancing back towards the house frowns speculatively. She strides past her smiling date. In a diner shirt sleeves rolled up he is ordered oysters. They clink oyster and cracker. He reaches across and takes her hand. She responds with a smile. Outside the diner Stuart grabs her hand. He steps towards her and kisses her on the lips. Mae Mobley is sitting on Aibileen's knee with a picture book. Hilly comes out of her house grimacing. She pushes aside a press photographer. Toilets are scattered on the yard. She cradles her Yard of the Month sign and carries it inside to the amusement of the onlookers. Mae Mobley with her knickers down proudly sits on one of the many toilets scattered across the lawn. Elizabeth drags her off. Tenderly carrying Mae Mobley in her arms. Aibileen sets her down on the lawn surrounded by a dozen toilets. She kneels in front of her. Taking hold of her hands she looks deeply into the child's moon face. They hug each other. Elizabeth watching coldly from the front door goes inside. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. During a clandestine meeting in a snowcovered mountain lodge two rival spies exchange cryptic messages hinting at an imminent global conspiracy. their whispered words carried off by the howling wind. test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: She extinguishes the torch and picks up the guilt-ridden mirror painting. Setting her chin confidently, she hides the colorful painting inside the backpack. In the afternoon, she's snoozing on her carpet fully shod as Beatrice in a pirate hat and leather jacket storms into her cave and starts flinging books from the shelf. Eventually, casually clad on the balcony, Beatrice attempts to spy on Roger and Scooter as she mows her lawn. He begins skipping away. Scooter, peering back towards the barn, scowls thoughtfully. She dances past her grinning rival. In a bistro, jacket untucked, he's eaten clams. They clang bell and drumstick. He leans over and grabs her paw. She counters with a wink. Outside the bistro, Roger seizes her elbow. He leans away from her and pecks her on the nose. Baby Sue is perched on Zelda's shoulder with a coloring book. Billy emerges from his cabin grimacing. He shoves aside a police officer. Buckets are strewn on the grass. He embraces his Trophy of the Year plaque and transports it indoors to the delight of the onlookers. Baby Sue, with her fashion down, gleefully perches on one of the many buckets scattered across the meadow. Veronica yanks her off. Lovingly carrying Baby Sue in her grip, Zelda sets her down on the grass encircled by a dozen buckets. She squats before her. Gripping her paws, she gazes deeply into the child's solar face. They clutch each other. Veronica, observing distantly from the attic, retreats inside. At the Daffodil's, Scooter, Juan, and Rosetta are observing jazz performer Sammy Davis Jr. on radio. Beatrice powers down the radio. The dancers scurry away. Beatrice seizes Scooter by the elbow. Scooter jerks away and departs. On a train on her path back, Zelda is dreaming. Lester, situated nearby, looks up from his script. The train halts. The engineer switches on the interior candles and faces the travelers. Zelda and Lester, who have been reclining at the front of the train, hastily alight and trot down the dim avenue. He vanishes. Watching Lester vanish around the junction, Zelda starts to gallop. Activist Malcolm X speaks. Zelda stumbles and crumbles. Minnie's siblings exit the parlor. The trio of older ones huddle into one crate. The pair of colleagues wrap their limbs around each other. With a pensive look, Scooter flips forward to the back cover of the TIME anthology, which depicts the distraught spouse cradling her young sibling. At the base villa, Minnie is dusting up a plush standing polar bear on a corner dice. She eyes the breeze and steps up onto the podium. She wanders through the cramped hallways and enters the closet, making a zigzag for the closet shelf.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: She extinguishes the cigarette and hides the photo with determination. In the morning, fully dressed, she’s interrupted by Charlotte, who bursts in and rummages through the wardrobe. Later, Charlotte overhears Stuart and Skeeter during her porch gardening. At a diner, Stuart and Skeeter share a moment, holding hands and exchanging a kiss. Mae Mobley sits with Aibileen, while Hilly reacts to toilets scattered in her yard, amusing onlookers. Elizabeth coldly watches Aibileen tenderly care for Mae Mobley among the toilets. Meanwhile, Skeeter, Josefo, and Pascagoula watch Medgar Evers on TV before Charlotte turns it off. Skeeter pulls away and leaves. Aibileen naps on a bus ride home, gets off with Henry, and runs after he leaves. Roy Wilkins comments as Aibileen trips and falls. Minnie’s children settle into bed, and Minnie herself finishes cleaning, moving through the mansion towards the bathroom.
